verbs.description: uncreate (third-person singular simple present uncreates, present participle uncreating, simple past and past participle uncreated)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To kill; to destroy; to deprive of existence; to annihilate.
(transitive) To undo the act of creating.
examples: They at least had the immense and mighty imagination of which I speak; they could unthink the past. They could uncreate the Fall. With a reverence which moderns might think impudence, they could uncreate the Creation.
